intro: Tibouchina moricandiana var. kunthiana, commonly known as the Kunth's tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-pink bracts that surround its small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
